thread.section_title: Reuters: Financial Services and Real Estate
thread.title: Former F-Squared CEO must pay $12.4 mln in SEC case: U.S. judge

title: Former F-Squared CEO must pay $12.4 mln in SEC case: U.S. judge
text: March 20, 2018 / 4:31 PM / Updated an hour ago Former F-Squared CEO must pay $12.4 mln in SEC case: U.S. judge Reuters Staff 1 Min Read BOSTON, March 20 (Reuters) - The former chief executive of F-Squared Investments Inc, once the largest U.S. money manager creating portfolios out of exchange-traded funds, must pay $12.4 million for making false statements to investors, a federal judge ruled on Tuesday. U.S. District Judge Leo Sorokin in Boston issued the order after a federal jury in October found that former F-Squared CEO Howard Present recklessly touted the history of his companyâ€™s flagship investment product. (Reporting by Nate Raymond in Boston)
